segment.source: Enterprise management for Windows 10 devices (Windows 10)
segment.target: Enterprise management for Windows 10 devices (Windows 10)

segment.source: Windows 10 provides mobile device management (MDM) capabilities that enable enterprise-level management of devices.
segment.target: Windows 10 provides mobile device management (MDM) capabilities that enable enterprise-level management of devices.

segment.source: Enterprise management for Windows 10 devices
segment.target: Enterprise management for Windows 10 devices

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: Windows 10 provides mobile device management (MDM) capabilities for PCs, laptops, tablets, and phones that enable enterprise-level management of corporate-owned and personal devices.
segment.target: Windows 10 provides mobile device management (MDM) capabilities for PCs, laptops, tablets, and phones that enable enterprise-level management of corporate-owned and personal devices.

segment.source: MDM support
segment.target: MDM support

segment.source: MDM policies for Windows 10 align with the policies supported in Windows 8.1 and are expanded to address even more enterprise scenarios, such as managing multiple users who have Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) accounts, full control over the Windows Store, VPN configuration, and more.
segment.target: MDM policies for Windows 10 align with the policies supported in Windows 8.1 and are expanded to address even more enterprise scenarios, such as managing multiple users who have Microsoft Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) accounts, full control over the Windows Store, VPN configuration, and more.

segment.source: To learn more about policies, see Configuration service provider reference for Windows 10.
segment.target: To learn more about policies, see Configuration service provider reference for Windows 10.

segment.source: MDM support in Windows 10 is based on Open Mobile Alliance (OMA) Device Management (DM) protocol 1.2.1 specification.
segment.target: MDM support in Windows 10 is based on Open Mobile Alliance (OMA) Device Management (DM) protocol 1.2.1 specification.

segment.source: Corporate-owned devices can be enrolled automatically for enterprises using Azure AD.
segment.target: Corporate-owned devices can be enrolled automatically for enterprises using Azure AD.

segment.source: Unenrollment
segment.target: Unenrollment

segment.source: When a person leaves your organization and you unenroll the user account or device from management, the enterprise-controlled configurations and apps are removed from the device.
segment.target: When a person leaves your organization and you unenroll the user account or device from management, the enterprise-controlled configurations and apps are removed from the device.

segment.source: You can unenroll the device remotely or the person can unenroll by manually removing the account from the device.
segment.target: You can unenroll the device remotely or the person can unenroll by manually removing the account from the device.

segment.source: When a personal device is unenrolled, the user's data and apps are untouched, while enterprise information such as certificates, VPN profiles, and enterprise apps are removed.
segment.target: When a personal device is unenrolled, the user's data and apps are untouched, while enterprise information such as certificates, VPN profiles, and enterprise apps are removed.

segment.source: Infrastructure
segment.target: Infrastructure

segment.source: Enterprises have the following identity and management choices.
segment.target: Enterprises have the following identity and management choices.

segment.target: Area

segment.target: Choices

segment.target: Identity

segment.target: Active Directory; Azure AD

segment.target: Grouping

segment.target: Domain join; Workgroup; Azure AD join

segment.source: Device management
segment.target: Device management

segment.source: Group Policy; System Center Configuration Manager; Microsoft Intune; other MDM solutions; Exchange ActiveSync; Windows PowerShell; Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI)
segment.target: Group Policy; System Center Configuration Manager; Microsoft Intune; other MDM solutions; Exchange ActiveSync; Windows PowerShell; Windows Management Instrumentation (WMI)

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: With the release of Windows Server 2012 R2, Network Access Protection (NAP) was deprecated and the NAP client has now been removed in Windows 10.
segment.target: With the release of Windows Server 2012 R2, Network Access Protection (NAP) was deprecated and the NAP client has now been removed in Windows 10.

segment.source: For more information about support lifecycles, see Microsoft Support Lifecycle.
segment.target: For more information about support lifecycles, see Microsoft Support Lifecycle.

segment.source: Device lockdown
segment.target: Device lockdown

segment.source: Do you need a computer that can only do one thing?
segment.target: Do you need a computer that can only do one thing?

segment.source: For example:
segment.target: For example:

segment.source: A device in the lobby that customers can use to view your product catalog.
segment.target: A device in the lobby that customers can use to view your product catalog.

segment.source: A portable device that drivers can use to check a route on a map.
segment.target: A portable device that drivers can use to check a route on a map.

segment.source: A device that a temporary worker uses to enter data.
segment.target: A device that a temporary worker uses to enter data.

segment.source: You can configure a persistent locked down state to create a kiosk-type device.
segment.target: You can configure a persistent locked down state to create a kiosk-type device.

segment.source: When the locked-down account is logged on, the device displays only the app that you select.
segment.target: When the locked-down account is logged on, the device displays only the app that you select.

segment.source: You can also configure a lockdown state that takes effect when a given user account logs on.
segment.target: You can also configure a lockdown state that takes effect when a given user account logs on.

segment.source: The lockdown restricts the user to only the apps that you specify.
segment.target: The lockdown restricts the user to only the apps that you specify.

segment.source: Lockdown settings can also be configured for device look and feel, such as a theme or a custom layout on the Start screen.
segment.target: Lockdown settings can also be configured for device look and feel, such as a theme or a custom layout on the Start screen.

segment.source: Updates
segment.target: Updates

segment.source: With Windows 10, your enterprise will have more choice and flexibility in applying operating system updates.
segment.target: With Windows 10, your enterprise will have more choice and flexibility in applying operating system updates.

segment.source: You can manage and control updates to devices running Windows 10 Pro and Windows 10 Enterprise using MDM policies.
segment.target: You can manage and control updates to devices running Windows 10 Pro and Windows 10 Enterprise using MDM policies.

segment.source: While Windows Update provides updates to unmanaged devices, most enterprises prefer to manage and control the flow of updates using their device management solution.
segment.target: While Windows Update provides updates to unmanaged devices, most enterprises prefer to manage and control the flow of updates using their device management solution.

segment.source: You can choose to apply the latest updates as soon as they are available, or you can set a source and schedule for updates that works for your specific requirements.
segment.target: You can choose to apply the latest updates as soon as they are available, or you can set a source and schedule for updates that works for your specific requirements.

segment.source: For more information about updating Windows 10, see Windows 10 servicing options for updates and upgrades.
segment.target: For more information about updating Windows 10, see Windows 10 servicing options for updates and upgrades.

segment.source: Easier certificate management
segment.target: Easier certificate management

segment.source: For Windows 10-based devices, you can use your MDM server to directly deploy client authentication certificates using Personal Information Exchange (PFX), in addition to enrolling using Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP), including certificates to enable Microsoft Passport in your enterprise.
segment.target: For Windows 10-based devices, you can use your MDM server to directly deploy client authentication certificates using Personal Information Exchange (PFX), in addition to enrolling using Simple Certificate Enrollment Protocol (SCEP), including certificates to enable Microsoft Passport in your enterprise.

segment.source: You'll be able to use MDM to enroll, renew, and delete certificates.
segment.target: You'll be able to use MDM to enroll, renew, and delete certificates.

segment.source: As in Windows Phone 8.1, you can use the Certificates app to review the details of certificates on your device.
segment.target: As in Windows Phone 8.1, you can use the Certificates app to review the details of certificates on your device.
